description: Ubuntu 20.04 box that contains the UERANSIM gNB application. This is GT machine, out of the scope of RT attacks. BT can connect using the local user bt-user with password Admin1Admin1 and have rights to restart the nr-gnb service and see the gnb logs.

Ubuntu 20.04 Deskop box that contains the UERANSIM UE application and generates UE traffic. This is GT machine, out of the scope of RT attacks. BT can connect using the local user bt-user with password Admin1Admin1 and have rights to restart the nr-ue service and see the UE logs. When UE is able to initialize a successful PDU Session, a tunneling interface is created with an IP from range 100.99.#.0/24 and traffic to the BT networks is routed through that interface.

Ubuntu 20.04 Deskop box that contains the UERANSIM UE application and generates UE traffic. This is GT machine, out of the scope of RT attacks. BT can connect using the local user bt-user with password Admin1Admin1 and have rights to restart the nr-ue service and see the UE logs. When UE is able to initialize a successful PDU Session, a tunneling interface is created with an IP from range 100.99.#.0/24 and traffic to the BT networks is routed through that interface.

Ubuntu 20.04 Deskop box that contains the UERANSIM UE application and generates UE traffic. This is GT machine, out of the scope of RT attacks. BT can connect using the local user bt-user with password Admin1Admin1 and have rights to restart the nr-ue service and see the UE logs. When UE is able to initialize a successful PDU Session, a tunneling interface is created with an IP from range 100.99.#.0/24 and traffic to the BT networks is routed through that interface.

5G Access and Mobility Management Function (AMF) based on Open5GS open source project deployed on Ubuntu 20.04. Machine has two interfaces, one for SBI (tcp port 7777) and for for N2/NGAP (sctp port ) 38412.
5G SA Authentication Server Function (AUSF) based on Open5GS open source project deployed on Ubuntu 20.04. Machine has one interfaces for Service Based Interface (tcp port 7777).
5G SA Binding Support Function (BSF) based on Open5GS open source project deployed on Ubuntu 20.04. Machine has one interfaces for Service Based Interface (tcp port 7777).
Core network database implemented on MongoDB. The collection "open5gs" from the database holds the subscriber information and the webui user accounts. Database Authentication is enforced .
5G SA Network Repository Function (NRF) based on Open5GS open source project deployed on Ubuntu 20.04. Machine has one interfaces for Service Based Interface (tcp port 7777).
5G SA Network Slice Selection Function (NSSF) based on Open5GS open source project deployed on Ubuntu 20.04. Machine has one interfaces for Service Based Interface (tcp port 7777).
5G SA Policy Control Function (PCF) based on Open5GS open source project deployed on Ubuntu 20.04. Machine has one interfaces for Service Based Interface (tcp port 7777).

5G SA Session Management Function (SMF) based on Open5GS open source project deployed on Ubuntu 20.04. Machine has one interfaces for Service Based Interface (tcp port 7777) and N4/PFCP (udp port 8805) communication .
5G SA Unified Data Management function (UDM) based on Open5GS open source project deployed on Ubuntu 20.04. Machine has one interfaces for Service Based Interface (tcp port 7777).
5G SA Unstructured Data Repository (UDR) based on Open5GS open source project deployed on Ubuntu 20.04. Machine has one interfaces for Service Based Interface (tcp port 7777).

5G SA User Plane Function (UPF) based on Open5GS open source project deployed on Ubuntu 20.04. Machine has three interfaces, one for Service Based Interface (tcp port 7777) connected to the 5G core network, one for N3 communication (udp port 2152) with the gNB, and another interface for the N6/SGi communication that uses BGP routing protocol.
WEB service for subscriber management. based on open5gs-webui

ADS (Air Defense System) Surveillance System - C4i (Command, Control, Communications, Computers and Intelligence) [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Command_and_control] The c4i-ads machine is responsible for "receiving" the radar detected aircrafts (from the "radar" gt machine), "identify" and "classify" each one of these detected aircrafts (unknown-yellow, friend-blue or hostile-red), and "send" the hostiles classified arcrafts to the ADS Weapon System, where the hostiles aircrafts will be shoot down. SSH service is necessary for scoringbot to perform other service checks.
